publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: 393-$5X1 1 BEHOLD the monarch-oaks, that rise393-$5X1 2 With lofty branches to the skies,393-$5X1 3 Have huge-proportion'd roots, which grow393-$5X1 4 With equal Longitude below──393-$5X1 5 Such is that fam'd mysterious tree393-$5X1 6 By mortals cleped, Poetry393-$5X1 7 Two Bards, who now in fashion reign,393-$5X1 8 Most aptly this device explain:393-$5X1 9 If this with clouds & stars will venture,393-$5X1 10 That creeps as far beneath the Center.393-$5X1 11 More to explain the thing I mean,393-$5X1 12 Have you not, in a Saw-pit, seen393-$5X1 13 A skill'd mechanic, who has stood393-$5X1 14 On a fal'n pyramid of wood,393-$5X1 15 And hir'd a subterranean Friend,393-$5X1 16 To take his Iron by the end?393-$5X1 17 But which excell'd, was never found,393-$5X1 18 The Man above, or under, ground.393-$5X1 19 The moral is so pat and fit,393-$5X1 20 That, were I but the God of wit,393-$5X1 21 Then in a saw-pit, in wet weather,393-$5X1 22 Should Young & Phillips work together393-$5X1
